parameters: bs
blooddotpng
Look under the bed?
Yes
No
Yes
There is a box under the bed, stuffed to the brim
with paper.
Most of it are complicated documents based on some sort
of goverment funded research project that you lack
context and field knowledge to understand.
There is a letter within the documents.
"Jenkins,
I'm sorry to write you in a time of mourning,
however this outcome is plain unacceptable."
"These morons wouldn't know what a breakthrough
is if it broke into their home and dropped on their
simple minded heads. - Excuse my language, but it
is simply outrageous that we've been put on hold."
"We may have lost a valuable source, however we can
build upon the data that has already been collected.
And lately I've been thinking... If it is so hard to
find a suitable test subject-"
"-may I be so bold to suggest that we create our own?
Not in love, but in the name of science.
It may  seem unethical, but I am willing to go this
far, if it is for the ideal guinea pig."
"Again, I apologize if this letter seems ill-mannered;
While I do believe such feelings have no place when
it comes to our field of research I also recognize that
it is quite unhealthy to ignore them."
"Before I end this letter, please know that I am
very sorry for your loss."
"Sofia will be missed as valuable coworker and friend.
May she rest in peace."
A
No
There is a single red book on an otherwise empty
bookshelf. You wonder if it should even count as such
with the outrageous lack of books.
Judging by the contents this book seems to be some
sort of journal. The author is listed as Dr. Clara
Carter.
"There has been no significant progress made in
the past years so Dale Jenkins has appointed me
as the new head researcher."
"The team seems vastly incompetent, aside from
Jenkins and his wife, Sofia."
"Especially Sofia seems to be of bright nature.
She will be useful."
"There is still little to no progress. Although the
theory is working, we haven't been able to secure
any suitable test subjects."
"Dr. Johnsons theory was based on human subjects.
As scientists, we have no use for a moral code.
If we don't start testing on humans soon, this
project is sure to fail."
"I will not let this happen."
"After a streak of failure we may have just hit
our break through. It appears that the perfect
test subject was right under our nose this whole time."
"The experiments aren't as consistently successful as
we need them to be."
"Has something happened? I don't understand...
What isn't adding up?"
"Seems like Sofia is still unaware of our testings."
"Perhaps I overestimated her, however, this is
the closest we've gotten. I mustn't give up so
easily."
This is where the journal ends.
There is a photograph stuck between the final pages.
lookatthisphotograph
There is a sticky note on the back of the picture.
note
Which entry do you want to read?
Sticky note
"There has been no significant progress made in
the past years so mr. Jenkins has appointed me
as the new head researcher."
"The team seems vastly incompetent, aside from
two of the other 'Experts' I had the pleasure
of meeting today."
"Especially Sofia seems to be of bright nature.
She will be useful."
"There is still little to no progress. Although the
theory is working, we have yet to find a fitting
test subject."
"If we don't find someone soon we'll be cut off.
I cannot let that happen.
Not after I was finally appointed to this project."
"After a streak of failure we may have just hit
our break through. It appears that the perfect
test subject was right under our nose this whole time."
"To think there was trauma behind that bright
smile of hers...Just goes to show that
you can't judge a book by its cover."
"The experiments aren't as consistently successful as
we need them to be."
"Has something happened? I don't understand...
What isn't adding up?"
"Lately Sofia doesn't smile as often anymore."
"Perhaps I overestimated her, however, this is
the closest we've gotten. I mustn't give up so
easily."
Sticky note
note
Look under the bed?
Yes
No
Yes
There is a box under the bed, stuffed to the brim
with paper.
Most of it are complicated documents based on some sort
of goverment funded research project that you lack
context and field knowledge to understand.
There is a letter within the documents.
"Jenkins,
I'm sorry to write you in a time of mourning,
however this outcome is plain unacceptable."
"These morons wouldn't know what a breakthrough
is if it broke into their home and dropped on their
simple minded heads. - Excuse my language, but it

"We may have lost a valuable source, however we can

And lately I've been thinking... If it is so hard to

"-may I be so bold to suggest that we create our own?
Not in love, but in the name of science.
It may  seem unethical, but I am willing to go this
far, if it is for the ideal guinea pig."
"Again, I apologize if this letter seems ill-mannered;
While I do believe such feelings have no place when
it comes to our field of research I also recognize that
it is quite unhealthy to ignore them."
"Before I end this letter, please know that I am
very sorry for your loss."
"Sofia will be missed as valuable coworker and friend.
May she rest in peace."
